page.title: 08LEIGH CHURCH
page.content: {All Saints Church}was built about 1250 in the mediaeval hamlet at Waterhay. The thirteenth century chancel still stands there, but in 1896 the nave, porch and bell-tower were moved stone by stone to stand beside the school, and a new chancel was built. Windows are fourteenth and fifteenth century with one fragment of the original glass. The bells are dated 1627 and 1729 and the third, inscribed Ave Matia Gracia Plena, is probably Bristol-made about 1450. Some of the pews are seventeenth century and the old font, which was found broken up and scattered, has been restored. Until the late l930's the parish of Ashton Keynes cum Leigh was served by a vicar and curate. In l985 Leigh, Ashton Keynes and Minety share one clergyman.
